info.title: Huli API
info.description:
Public API for the Huli healthcare platform providing endpoints for practice management, 
EHR (Electronic Health Records), patient management, and healthcare integrations.

## API Version
This documentation covers v2 endpoints. All new integrations should use v2 endpoints exclusively.

## Getting Started
Begin with the authentication endpoints below to obtain access credentials and learn about required headers.

tags.name: Patient Management
tags.description: Patient and patient file management operations

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhook event notifications for external systems

post.description:
Exchange your API key for a JWT token required for all authenticated requests.

**API Key Access:**
API keys must be requested through support channels by the organization owner. 
The organization ID (`id_organization`) will be provided alongside the API key.

**Usage:**
1. Include the returned JWT token in the Authorization header: `Bearer {token}`
2. Include the organization ID in the `id_organization` header for request scoping

Most endpoints require the `id_organization` header to validate the request scope.

get.description:
Retrieve organization information including healthcare professionals.

**Authorization Details:**
Use the `expand=AUTHORIZATION` query parameter to retrieve detailed authorization 
information, including the `idGrantor` fields which contain the doctor user IDs 
associated with the organization. This provides access to healthcare professional 
identifiers for further API operations.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Include additional details in the response

post.description:
Create a new patient file in the Master Patient Index (MPI). This endpoint creates a comprehensive 
patient record including personal data, contact information, insurance details, and emergency contacts.

The patient file serves as the central record for all patient-related information across the Huli platform.

get.description: List all patient files accessible to the user within their organization

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search filter - can be a phone number, patient name, or identification number

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

200.description: List of patient files with pagination

patientFiles.description: Array of simplified patient file objects

idUser.description: ID of user who created the record

knownAs.description: Name the patient is commonly known by (when available)

total.description: Total number of patient files available

size.description: Number of patient files returned in current response

get.description: Retrieve a specific patient file by ID

post.description: Upload a document to a specific patient file

get.description:
Retrieve a patient's complete medical record.

**Note:** This endpoint uses v1 format. The response format follows v1 conventions rather than the standardized v2 format used by other endpoints.

parameters.name: ownerID
parameters.description: Organization owner ID (user ID of the organization owner)

get.description: Retrieve complete checkup information
Retrieve prescription details from a checkup
Retrieve vital signs recorded during a checkup
Retrieve diagnosis information from a checkup
Retrieve lab procedure requests from a checkup
Retrieve patient suffering or symptoms from a checkup
Retrieve reason for visit from a checkup
Retrieve physical examination notes from a checkup
Retrieve systematic examination details from a checkup
Retrieve review of systems from a checkup
Retrieve sleep pattern information from a checkup
Retrieve anthropometric measurements from a checkup
Retrieve last menstrual cycle information from a checkup
Retrieve general notes from a checkup
Retrieve bowel habit information from a checkup
Retrieve treatment plan notes from a checkup
Retrieve custom questions and answers from a checkup
Get available time slots for a doctor at a specific clinic

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date-time for availability range (ISO 8601 format)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date-time for availability range (ISO 8601 format)

post.description:
Schedule a new appointment between patients and doctors.

**Required fields**: `id_doctor`, `id_clinic`, `start_date`, `time_from`

**Appointment Duration Options:**
- Provide `source_event` (availability slot ID) - system calculates `end_date` and `time_to` automatically
- OR provide `end_date` and `time_to` manually
- One of these approaches is required

**Recommendation**: Using `source_event` is recommended to ensure the appointment is created during an available time slot. 
Query availability endpoints first to get valid slot IDs.

**Core Requirements:**
- Doctor must be associated with the specified clinic

**Permission-Based Restrictions:**
Some users may have additional business rules enforced, such as:
- Appointments must be scheduled at least 1 hour in advance
- Patient cannot have multiple appointments with same doctor on same day  
- Maximum 3 appointments per patient per day (when patient file provided)

**Important**: Business rules and validation requirements vary significantly based on user-specific permissions. 
The above restrictions are examples that may or may not apply to your API key.

get.description: Retrieve appointment details by event ID

put.description:
Update appointment details.

**Requirements:**
- Appointment must have status `BOOKED`
- Field availability depends on user permissions

Cancel an appointment, changing its status to `CANCELLED` and availability to `IGNORE`.

**Effects:**
- Status changes from `BOOKED` to `CANCELLED`
- Availability changes from `BUSY` to `IGNORE`
- Sets `isStatusModifiedByPatient` flag based on request

is_status_modified_by_patient.description: Flag to indicate if the cancellation was requested by the patient

put.description:
Mark an appointment as confirmed by patient.

**Effects:**
- Sets `isConfirmedByPatient` to `true`
- Appointment status remains `BOOKED`

Reschedule an existing appointment to a new date and time.

**Requirements:**
- Only appointments with status `BOOKED` can be rescheduled
- Appointments with associated checkups cannot be rescheduled
- Field availability depends on user permissions

**Effects:**
- Creates new appointment with new date/time
- Original appointment marked as `RESCHEDULED`
- Sends notifications to patient and provider

**Business Rules:**
- Maximum 3 appointments per patient per day
- No overlapping appointments for same patient
- Must be scheduled in the future with advance notice

isStatusModifiedByPatient.description: Flag to indicate if the reschedule was requested by the patient

startDate.description: New start date for the appointment (YYYY-MM-DD)

timeFrom.description: New start time for the appointment (HH:MM:SS)

endDate.description: New end date for the appointment (YYYY-MM-DD)

timeTo.description: New end time for the appointment (HH:MM:SS)

sourceEvent.description: Availability event ID for the new appointment slot

put.description:
Mark an appointment as no-show when patient doesn't attend.

**Requirements:**
- Appointment status must be `BOOKED` or `COMPLETED`
- Appointment must be in the past (cannot mark future appointments)

**Effects:**
- Creates new appointment record with status `NOSHOW`
- Inactivates original appointment record
- Sends notifications to patient and provider

get.description:
Get all appointments for a specific doctor with filtering and pagination support.

**Required Parameters:**
- Date range (`from` and `to`) is mandatory for filtering appointments

**Filtering:**
- Filter by appointment status, clinic, or pagination
- All appointments within date range returned by default

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

200.description: List of appointments with pagination metadata

total.description: Total number of appointments matching the criteria

size.description: Number of appointments returned in this response

get.description: Get all appointments for a specific patient with filtering and pagination support.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

200.description: List of appointments with pagination metadata

total.description: Total number of appointments matching the criteria

size.description: Number of appointments returned in this response

get.description:
Get all available booking tags for the organization with pagination support.

Tags can be used to categorize and filter appointments based on custom organizational criteria.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tags to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of tags to skip for pagination

200.description: List of booking tags with pagination metadata

size.description: Number of tags returned in this response

get.description:
Get doctor information by doctor ID from the doctor service.

This endpoint retrieves comprehensive doctor data including specialties, clinic associations, and user information.
Get doctor information by user ID
Get doctor information at a specific clinic
Get doctor's phone number at a specific clinic
Get doctor's address at a specific clinic

address.example: 123 Medical Plaza, Building A, Floor 2, Office 15

post.description:
Webhook notifications sent when appointment-related events occur in the system.

**Event Types:**
- `APPOINTMENT_CREATED` - Triggered when a new appointment is scheduled
- `APPOINTMENT_UPDATED` - Triggered when appointment details are modified
- `APPOINTMENT_CANCELLED` - Triggered when an appointment is cancelled
- `APPOINTMENT_RESCHEDULED` - Triggered when an appointment is moved to a different time

**Setup Required:**
Webhook subscriptions must be requested through Huli support. Contact support with your webhook endpoint URL, preferred authentication method, and which events you want to receive.

Webhook notifications sent when checkup-related events occur in the system.

**Event Types:**
- `CHECKUP_CREATED` - Triggered when a new checkup is completed
- `CHECKUP_UPDATED` - Triggered when checkup data is modified

**Using Webhook Data:**
The checkup data provided in the webhook payload can be used to retrieve detailed information using the checkup API endpoints in the "EHR - Checkups" section. Use the `id_event` field to fetch specific checkup data like vital signs, systematic examination, and other checkup details.

**Setup Required:**
Webhook subscriptions must be requested through Huli support. Contact support with your webhook endpoint URL, preferred authentication method, and which events you want to receive.

bearerAuth.description: JWT authentication token. Include in the Authorization header as: Bearer {token}

webhookAuth.description:
Authentication for webhook delivery. The specific authentication method depends on your webhook configuration setup with Huli support. Available methods include:
- Bearer tokens
- API keys in headers
- OAuth 2.0
- Session-based authentication

OrganizationId.name: id_organization
OrganizationId.description: Organization ID for scoping operations to a specific organization

id.description: Unique identifier for this webhook delivery

event.description: Type of event that triggered this webhook

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the event occurred

id.description: Unique identifier for this webhook delivery

event.description: Type of appointment event that triggered this webhook

data.description: Checkup-specific data payload. Use the `id_event` field to retrieve detailed checkup information using the checkup API endpoints in the "EHR - Checkups" section.

id_event.description: Internal event identifier - use this with checkup API endpoints to retrieve detailed data
